title: Trevor Wooley
summary: Trevor Dion Wooley FRS (born 17 September 1964) is a British mathematician and currently Professor of Mathematics at Purdue University.  His fields of interest include analytic number theory, Diophantine equations and Diophantine problems, harmonic analysis, the Hardy-Littlewood circle method, and the theory and applications of exponential sums.  He has made significant breakthroughs on Waring's problem, for which he was awarded the Salem Prize in 1998.
